comments.comment: I was a child sex abuse detective and investigated CSAM (child sex abuse material, formerly referred to as child pornography). My hats off to these men for bringing these horrors into the sunlight. This is such a problem inside the US. Many of the kids are completely forgotten with no one to advocate for them. So often they grow up to enter the criminal justice route. I've interviewed hundreds of these kids and 99% have one thing in common: parents abused drugs and little to no family structure.  Imagine an American resurgence of the nuclear family. I can't help but believe it would alleviate so many of our societal ills.  Also, 31:23 makes me choke up. The stuff you're exposed to is so evil and horrific. I pray he has counseling and help to process the images. EMDR and psilocybin helped me become human again after I retired.

comments.comment: 28:20 "You're a person of faith and that's a requirement, or your soul will be crushed." So true. I have a good friend who was a child psychologist but had to retire at an early age despite being very successful. When I asked him why, he got very, very serious and shared with me a small sample of the cases he used to work. They are still seared into my brain 15 years later. But, the reason he had to retire was because he was suffering from PTSD. That is how horrifying the evil that is perpetrated on children is, and right here in the USA. It takes a massive amount of faith to confront evil head on. It took me a while to get over what he shared with me. I'll never repeat it, and I no longer think about evil the same.

comments.comment: @1:10:00 this hit me like a ton of bricks. I am currently a Major in the Army, about 8 years from retirement. Recently I have been feeling God push me towards getting out. I have the same thing on the line; having a federal retirement with benefits in a few short years. I want to fight the darkness, not benefit from the darkness. This has really made a major impact on me in a very consequential way.  Once again, I am reminded of my favorite quote from Braveheart: "Your heart is free. Have the courage to go follow it"

comments.comment: 1:14:02 It makes sense to me!  I had to endure 8 years of hell on this earth.  And just when I thought I had hit rock bottom, things got worse and I felt I had fallen into a pit that Satan made and tried to keep me.  I felt I could not take it anymore to the point that I gave all my burdens to Christ!  I gave all my burdens to Christ!  And let God‚Äôs will be done!  I was willing to give my own life!  And then that‚Äôs when Jesus took over.  And ever since then, I have ABSOLUTE FAITH IN GOD!  I may not understand everything, but I do Not need to understand everything; I just need to trust in God!  That day Jesus came to my heart and healed it and gave me peace!  My life changed that day and I thank God!
